entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation - Automation does not complete/finish
entry.content:
Dear community,

i sat up an workflow in SAP Build Process Automation. The trigger is a pretty basic formular which i need to submit. After that, my automation starts. But here is the problem: the automation starts, executes properly but never comes to finish.

Furthermore, the output parameter of the automation is filled properly, available in the workflow but cant be used due to the fact that the automation is never stopping/completed or somehow finished. In the screenshots below and attached to this question i provided details about this issue. What can i do that the automation comes to an end?

The automation itself works in the tests without any issue and all the values are correctly parsed and mapped. It just doesn't continue as you can see in the screenshots and therefore no further steps in the workflow are executed.

Here are further screenshots additionally to the screenshots in the attachments:

entry.title: How to Specify SAP DMS Repository for Different Projects in SAP Build Process Automation?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We’ve integrated SAP Document Management Service (DMS) with SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) by creating a destination in our BTP subaccount. After this setup, BPA forms started showing the option to upload documents, and the files are getting stored in DMS.

In our destination configuration, we specified a repository ID, and all uploaded documents are automatically saved in that specific repository. BPA is even organizing the documents by creating a dedicated folder for each form submission, which is great.

However, here’s the challenge:

We have multiple projects in BPA within the same subaccount, and we’d like to use different repositories for different projects. But currently, I don’t see any way in BPA to specify or override the repository per project or per form.

Is there a way to specify the DMS repository that a particular BPA project or process should use for file uploads?
If not directly in BPA, is there any workaround or recommendation?

Any insights or best practices would be appreciated!

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation: Test Automation vs Attended Agent Execution
entry.content:
Hello!

I am learning SAP Build Process Automation and have hit an issue I can't seem to find details about online. Hoping someone here can help.

Context:

I have designed a simple automation that does the following:

1. Ask User to Enter in a Value using Input Dialog.

2. Create a New Section in OneNote.

3. Rename Section in OneNote (using Text from Input Dialog).

4. Rename Page in the Section.

5. Add a new Page to the Section.

6. Rename the new Page in the Section, after waiting for 2000ms.

Problem:

When I execute this automation in test mode in the Automation Editor, it works perfectly. When I execute the released version using my Attended Mode Agent, I get the Input Dialog, then the Automation Fails with the following error: "Timeout error: Waiting for screen(s) [Name of Automation Screen] to appear (30 s)."

Why is my test of the automation able to find the screen and execute the automation, but the Attended Agent execution is not able to find the screen and complete the automation.

This is all occurring on my personal desktop. I have not changed the applications open/available between Attended Agent failure and Test Mode success. I can literally run Attended and Test mode back to back repeatedly, and Attended Mode fails, and Test Mode works; every time.

Thank you in advance for any advice.

entry.title: Re: SAP Build Process automation mail notification
entry.content: I think this post should be moved to the Technology Q&A part of SAP Community.

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation - Number of processes / comparision to others
entry.content:
Hi community,

perhaps this is a uncommon question, but I would like to know whether we are a "big player" or a "small light" in the SAP Build Process Automation community.

Here is our setup:

- 2 developers (only some hours during the week)

- 87 projects in the build lobby

- 628 automation runs in month July / around 20 automations a day

- Started in 2021 (with iRPA)

Thanks to everyone who participates.

Best Regards

Mathias

entry.title: Moving Gmail Inbox Emails to Subfolders Using Message ID in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content: Hi  Everyone , I am currently working with SAP Build Process Automation on a use case where I need to manage Gmail emails. The requirement is to identify an email in the Inbox using the unique Message ID provided by Gmail and then move this email from the Inbox to a custom subfolder within the Inbox. I have tried using the Move Email (Online) activity, but I am facing challenges as the activity does not seem to recognize the custom subfolder, and the process fails when I attempt to move the email using the Message ID. I would like to know the recommended approach for fetching Gmail emails based on Message ID and the correct way to configure the target folder path when moving emails into subfolders or labels. Any guidance, best practices, or configuration examples from the community would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: SAP Build Issues with S/4 HANA Attachments for Controlling Documents
entry.content:
Hello,

We've found a potential bug with the SAP Build attachments process with S/4 HANA (version 2020).  When we use the POST AttachmentContentSet method for accounting documents (BusinessObjectType = BKPF) we are able to see the attachments after the process runs.  We check them in SAP GUI or Fiori.  

However, when we attempt to use the same method with FIN Controlling documents (BusinessObjectType = BUS2072), we are only able to see the attachments in SAP GUI or Fiori if someone creates an attachment through the GUI or Fiori first.  If no attachment is created through the GUI or Fiori, the attachments created by SAP Build through the POST AttachmentContentSet method are not visible in the GUI or Fiori.

MS Copilot reports that this is because there is no BINARY_RELATION_CREATE_COMMIT with BusinessObjectType = BUS2072, but there is with BusinessObjectType = BKPF.  While I cannot confirm this, I was hoping an expert in the community might be able to confirm if this is a bug?

entry.title: Install SAP build process automation desktop agent for macOS
entry.content:
Hello community,

I want to install desktop agent for macOS but I can't find a way to get the installer. I've followed instructions in SAP help (https://help.sap.com/docs/build-process-automation/sap-build-process-automation/install-macos-agent-3?locale=en-US) but the installer doesn't appear on the download page of build process automation -> control tower -> agents.

I am working on a BTP trial account, macOS version Sequoia 15.6.1, chip Apple M3 max.

I appreciate any help you can give me.

entry.title: Build Process automation approval form request isn’t showing up in the Workzone My Inbox
entry.content:
In SAP Build Process Automation (Standard subscription), the approval form requests aren’t showing up in the Workzone My Inbox for new business users. However, it’s working fine for the three older business users. I’ve checked, and both new and old users have the same roles assigned, so I’m not sure what’s causing the difference.

Do we need to map CIS business users somewhere in the tenant configuration or make any additional setup for new users?

Would really appreciate your insights on this issue to resolve it.

#SAPBuildProcessAutomation
#WorkzoneInbox
#ApprovalFormIssue
#BusinessUserMapping
#TenantConfiguration
#CISUserSetup
#WorkflowTroubleshooting
#SAPSupport
#AutomationIssue
#UserAccessIssue

entry.title: Cannot start any of my Automation anymore
entry.content:
Hi,
I’ve been experiencing a problem with SAP Build Process Automation since last Friday.

  • I did not change anything in my automation.

  • Other users who could previously start the automation also cannot start it anymore.
  • The Start button, which normally displays in German as “Weiter”, now shows “Next” when the form loads.
  • As soon as I interact with a text field, dropdown, or any element that triggers onChange, the button becomes enabled, switches to German, and the automation works.
  • This happens in multiple browsers (Edge, Chrome, Incognito) and across different tenants/regions.

Additional info:

  • Network logs show 404 errors for some UI5 Web Components and missing /i18n files. The screenshot shows the errors. 

Has anyone encountered a similar issue? Any advice or workaround would be appreciated.

entry.title: Material Document Goods Receipt Custom Field
entry.content:
Hi Good day 

Any one has done this issue 

so i was basically posting 2 Items Under GR with Custom Field of Date

I'm using script to format the date to epoch from Build Process Automation



This is my Payload


The issue here is whenever the item line of custom field was different it appear on both GR as same data 

for example 

ITEM 1

 "YY1_Ambient_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
 "YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "",
 " YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",

ITEM 2

 "YY1_Ambient_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
 "YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
"YY1_Chilled_Exp_Date_MMI":""

The Material Document Items would be 

ITEM 1 & 2

 "YY1_Ambient_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
"YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
 " YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",


 FIELD MAPPING

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation - Rest Call Web Service
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am trying to understand the underlying communication of SAP Desktop Agent. If my Automation has a "REST Call Web Service" Activity, does the Desktop Agent directly calls the URL configured in custom script - Call Web Service Activity | SAP Help Portal, or Desktop Agent communicates with BTP that then communicates with the URL?

I have a setup such that BTP (BPA) is hosted on Azure hyperscaler while my VM resides under GCP (that has Desktop Agent). The URL is also hosted under GCP within same VPC. I want to understand if I need to make changes in network configurations to enable this service call?
SAP Build Process Automation
Thanks, Shruti

entry.title: ビジネスプロセスをデプロイする際に宛先を指定するのですが、宛先が全く表示されません
entry.content:
ビジネスプロセスにcreate sales orderのアクションを使用し、SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC に受注伝票を登録しようとしております。このビジネスプロセスをデプロイしようとすると宛先を選択する画面が出てくるのですが、選択肢に何も出力されません。

BTPCOKPITのDESTINATIONS（宛先）にSAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLICにつながるHTTP宛先、saphelpに載っていたsap_process_automation_service、sap_process_automation_service_user_accessは追加しております。

どのように設定すればデプロイ時の宛先の選択肢に出てくるでしょうか

entry.title: How to Integrate SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Perfect 👍 Here’s your full rephrased + enhanced message including the part about creating an Action for file upload. You can use this directly in your SAP Community or Blog:

I have created an instance of SAP Document AI and built a few custom schemas to read PDFs. Everything works fine when tested directly in Document AI.

Now, I want to integrate it with SAP Build Process Automation (BPA). For this, I have already created a destination.

My question:
👉 How can I create an Action in BPA to upload a file to Document AI?

  • Do we need to use a Custom Script to achieve this, or is it recommended to only create Actions in BPA and then call them in a process?

If the recommended approach is to use an Action, can someone guide me on how to create an Action in BPA for file upload?

Specifically:

  • How should the input parameters (like PDF file and options JSON) be defined in the Action?

  • How do we configure the multipart/form-data request inside the Action?

  • Once created, can this Action be directly reused in different BPA processes for uploading files?

Would really appreciate your guidance. Thanks in advance!

For reference, below are the steps I followed in Postman which work successfully:

Step 1: Upload the PDF

Call the Upload API with multipart/form-data.

  • file → PDF document

  • options → JSON with schema details

Example:

{
  "schemaId": "69d84f47-b658-46fb-a330-d9aadd602112",
  "clientId": "default",
  "documentType": "invoice"
}

👉 Response returns a Job ID.

Step 2: Check Job Status

Use the Get Job API with the Job ID.
Proceed when status = SUCCEEDED.

Step 3: Fetch Extracted Data

Call the Get Result API with the Job ID to get the extracted data in JSON format (header details, line items, etc.).

✅ Now, I’m looking for help on how to configure this same upload flow as an Action in SAP BPA, so I can call it directly from an automation.

entry.title: Purchase Order API Posting Error FROM SAP BTP BPA
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I was trying to post a Purchase Order via BPA, and this is the error I received:

 

Spoiler
 "Add new entity to PurchaseOrder 2" failed
Error message: Action '580dfd8f-e028-4e36-8ec3-94b97578cc89' failed with the following error: '400 Bad Request Request Details: { "status code": 400, "url": "S4HANA_DEV_TENANT + /sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_purchaseorder_2/srvd_a2x/sap/purchaseorder/0001/PurchaseOrder","raw response": "{"error":{"code":"SY/530","message":"An exception was raised","target":"","@SAP__common.ExceptionCategory":"Provider_Application_Error","innererror":{"ErrorDetails":{"@SAP__common.Application":{"ComponentId":"MM-PUR-PO","ServiceRepository":"SRVD_A2X","ServiceId":"API_PURCHASEORDER_2","ServiceVersion":"0001"},"@SAP__common.TransactionId":"A43F532D070C00A0E0068BA5847BF9DE","@SAP__common.Timestamp":"20250905093415.00889","@SAP__common.ErrorResolution":{"Analysis":"Use ADT feed reader \"SAP Gateway Error Log\" or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details","Note":"See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis (https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736)"}}}}}" }'.
Log ID: ba5e887e-536f-4982-b6ca-c794246-us10

 


I tried using the payload with the action, and surprisingly, it worked.



I mapped out in Inputs on BPA


 I’d appreciate any help in resolving this issue. Thanks in advance.
